text.section:
After a solicitation is issued and until a recommendation is made by a procurement officer, a procurement officer may disclose to a person outside the Executive Department only:
whether a decision has been made regarding a solicitation; and
information that is available to the public under §§ 10-611 through 10-628 of the State Government Article.

After a solicitation is issued, a procurement officer shall record and include in the procurement file the following information from an inquiry from a source outside the Executive Department:
the date and time of the inquiry;
the name and affiliation of the person making the inquiry; and
the substance and nature of the inquiry.
